name: Set Of Ten Finger Hands Finger Puppets

reviews.review_text: After waiting two long days, for these to arrive..Today was finally the day. I must say this is (baby) hands down the best purchase I've made. I'm free to drink, smoke and write this helpful review! Buy them and you too will have hilarious snap chats..and be able to rub your friends faces with your tiny hands.
reviews.review_header: No regrets

reviews.review_text: The product description says 5 right and 5 left hands. I ended up with 7 right hands and 3 left hands. The product itself is exactly what I wanted, but I'm disappointed that I didn't get the correct proportions.
reviews.review_header: Wrong proportions

reviews.review_text: While I love these Finger Hands, I do have some issues with them. The paint wears down quickly and make the hands look darker and more dirty, although it makes the veins on the back look more real. I received 7 right hands and 3 left hands. I don't know if the description was changed from when I ordered, but the current description says only right hands. It would be nice to have an equal number of left and right hands. I like having the thumbs match my thumbs. We take these everywhere and either get excitement and smiles out of people or get awkward and creeped out looks. I love the details with the veins and fingerprints though. They are a little tight on my fingers, but I think most people won't have this issue.
reviews.review_header: I love these but they wear out quickly and have an inconsistent quantity of each hands.

reviews.review_text: Ordering this, you get 10 tiny hands — 5 right hands and 5 left hands. I've seen many reviews where they get an uneven number of right and left hands but that was not the case for me; I guess I was lucky. It seems these rubber hands are made by the company "MCPHEE". Considering these ARE rubber hands, they do get dirty quite easily and will require cleaning with soap. Color does not rub off! Still a funny gag toy! (The hands are really detailed by the way) In conclusion: BUY AT YOUR RISK: - because they might come in uneven numbers of right and left hands - the wrong hand color PROS: Hey, in the end, you still got 10 mini hands, so smile!
reviews.review_header: A set of 10 but hands, awesome gag toy!

reviews.review_text: These are hands-down the best additions to my office desk at work that I think I've ever had. And I have to hand it to the manufacturer; I give 'em a high 5 for their product. My co-workers really appreciate it even more now when I give them a little hand on a project.
reviews.review_header: Gotta Hand it to ya...

reviews.review_text: Extremely dissatisfied! I received 6 right hands, 4 left hands, and one of them is brown while the others are all white. This is an assortment, not a set. I want my money back.
reviews.review_header: Dishonest. You do not receive a "set"

reviews.review_text: i LOVE these, i am a so-called artist and i have ALREADY used the bad-boys in several assemblage pieces and i am just so THRILLED!!! they look so authentic and they are quite mailable for working into tight spaces. i totally caught attention to several people saying that MIRACULOUSLY this company is so stoned that they MISS correct Amount of left / right hands and thus bought extras in anticipation. and true to form, blessum, i got an odd set of pairings, no matter... just plan aheads and stop your whining at the amazing price for quality stuff!! oh and i was at some airport and the TSA guy was wearing these at security hahahahahahha, so very funny and a great conversation ensued on our OMG i have those hands too!!
reviews.review_header: i LOVE these, i am a so-called artist and i ...

reviews.review_text: Received seven left hands and three right hands. I was rather disappointed not to have even numbers of each appendage! Otherwise, they're exactly what they seem.
reviews.review_header: So funny, so creepy

name: Viviscal Extra Strength Hair Nutrient Tablets, 90-Tablets

reviews.review_text: I have been using Viviscal for a little over a month now, and it is a nice natural product, it is basically a vitamin for your hair. I use it together with Minoxigaine Minoxigaine by Hairgenics FDA Approved Hair Growth Formula with 5% Minoxidil Plus Powerful DHT Blockers which is a combination of rogaine's minoxidil with other hair growth ingredients that really work, I definitely notice less shedding and some new hair growth.
reviews.review_header: I Like Viviscal

reviews.review_text: I do not believe the item being sold here is the authentic Viviscal Extra Strength Pill. I read the reviews before purchasing, which questioned the authenticity of this product, but chose to ignore it since the vendor was viviscal. BIG MISTAKE. While packaging may change, and the items with older packaging are commonly reduced in price; i do not believe this is the same product as what is sold from other vivscal retailers. First, after taking this product for 3.5 weeks, I saw no change in hair loss. Second, after taking this product for 3.5 weeks I developed a horribly dry/rashy scalp. It was unbearably dry, flaky, and itchy. I decided to stop taking viviscal. My scalp eventually recovered. believing this product not to be the real deal, I purchased it at Target for $35.00. The packing is almost exactly the same but as mentioned in a previous review, the lot numbers are different. Amazon viviscal is alpha numerical, and targets in just numerical. The pill packaging is different which could fall under the packaging my vary description. The biggest and most disturbing difference is in the pill itself. The pills from target which is a verified Viviscal retailer, are denser, a totally different color and have a grainier look to it. This made me wonder what did I buy from Amazon? The pills look and smell different despite the Supplement Facts being EXACTLY the same. I have no idea what I was ingesting believing it to be Viviscal, and I would strongly recommend that NO ONE buys this from Amazon. Target might be a little bit more but it is worth it for an authentic product that does not potentially give you an awful reaction!
reviews.review_header: NOT THE SAME ITEM SOLD BY OTHER OFFICIAL VIVISCAL RETAILERS. RIP OFF.

reviews.review_text: I've been using this on and off for a few years. I noticed in the last year it was not working as well, my hair was not growing as fast. I read other reviews stating it wasn't the same product as sold by the company or say another distributor like Walgreens or CVS. I went to Walgreens to purchase and sure enough the pills look, taste, and smell differently. I saw more results in less than one month of taking the pills from the store than I did in 3 months with the ones from Amazon.
reviews.review_header: Suspicious of Product Authenticity

reviews.review_text: Amazon.com has allowed false reviews to flourish on this product page. I have called their attention to one that uses MY IMAGE without authorization (username: Kate, who has also posted a number of other seemingly false reviews on numerous unrelated products), and Amazon has refused to take it down. The reviews you are reading for this product are largely FAKE, as are many others on Amazon.com, most likely. I have used this product and found it to be lacking.
reviews.review_header: FAKE REVIEWS on this page; product doesn't work

reviews.review_text: Please do not buy, these are fake, only God knows what they actually put in these pills for human consumption, pills began turning black after a few days of opening. Also when compared to another pack I bought from a store, these had no batch code and other stuff were very different from the original.
reviews.review_header: Pills turned Black

reviews.review_text: It's been about 20 days and I've only been taking one a day (at night) because the tablets were causing my skin to break out a lot. I'm not sure if I've noticed a difference but a good friend said my hair texture was less frizzy. My nails are super strong and long, however. I am confident that I'll see improvement in my hair with continued use. Update: The pills in first batch I ordered were wide and flat and made in Ireland (supposedly). I definitely have noticed a difference in my hair quality since I've been taking them. Just ordered my second box and the packaging looks like a knockoff, as well as the pills being smaller in diameter and thicker and made in the US (supposedly). I emailed Viviscal the lot numbers and expiration dates so hopefully they can confirm which batch is real. I will be returning these pills pending their response. There is a reason the price is significantly cheaper than the pills at the store. (First order is the box/pills on the right and the lot number on the bottom; second order is left/top. I think the second one is the fake.) Update #2: I checked the lot numbers and expiration dates with the company and they told me that both boxes were legit but they have two factories, which would account for the differences in the pills. However, the second box (made in the US) is giving me really bad, unrelenting acne. The first box from Ireland also caused breakouts but that subsided after a week or so whereas this time it won't stop. If I can consistently get the pills made in Ireland, I'll keep taking them cause they definitely do seem to be making some difference. If not, the acne is a dealbreaker.
reviews.review_header: Ireland-made pills are better if you can secure them. Watch out for breakouts!

name: Jensen CD-490 Sport Stereo CD Player with AM/FM Radio and Aux Line-In, Red and Black

reviews.review_text: This is a real review by an actual paying customer not a seller-discounted product for a good review. I am a Machinist/Engineer for 40 years and I own 3 Bose Wave radios and a Bose Home Theater Surround sound system so I know, pay for and demand high quality true-to-life sound. I work in a dirty, noisy, machinery-filled environment and needed a small, lightweight unit to play CD's with acceptable sound. This one is perfect. It plays excellent quality Jensen speaker sound without the amplified, artificially boosted "super bass" that everyone seems to want. I have very eclectic music taste from Smooth Jazz to real Jazz to Blues and Classical music. I attended Symphony performances for years so I know what Real live music sounds like not the massive, artificially amplified pounding sound at an indoor or outdoor concert. Bose produces actual real lifelike sound and surprisingly, for it's price this does pretty dam good. It's small and light and fits easily into my rollaway toolbox compartment. And if it gets ruined at work I've spent less than $50 and would just get another one. My Bose Wave radios cost $500 each and I won't even mention the cost of the Home Theater system! Not even close to a Bose very good sound for this price.
reviews.review_header: WOW! What good sound at this price.

reviews.review_text: I like to listen to music when getting ready for work and this player fits perfect on my bathroom counter. Looks great, sounds great and a great price. Very very happy with it.
reviews.review_header: Great CD player

reviews.review_text: I'm so glad I bought this CD player, AM/FM Radio. It has wonderful sound and does exactly what I need it to do and the price was right. It's small and easy to work.
reviews.review_header: Jensen CD Player AM/FM Radio Great

reviews.review_text: I was impressed by the sound quality given its size and weight. It's small, lightweight, easy to carry around and sounds great!
reviews.review_header: Good sound out of a little box!

reviews.review_text: I bought this CD player even given the negative reviews, as I wasn't giving it to kids and it shouldn't break if I didn't do anything to it. Right? WRONG. The CD Play states it was manufactured September 2016. I bought it in November 2016. It died June 15th, 2017! This was a total life span of 9 to 10 months. I was listening the radio and the sound went off. I thought the radio station had stopped working, but it quickly became clear that it wasn't getting power. Given that it had never been dropped and it was less than a year old I called the manufacturer. The Jensen representative told me it is only a 3 month full warranty. Had I tried using batteries? After 3 months, you have to pay $20 for them to even look at it and possibly replace it or fix it. The CD player only costs $24, so this is a good deal for them. She was willing to send me a new cable in case that was the problem. I got the cable today and it wasn't the problem. The problem is the extremely poor manufacturing. No longer worried about voiding a worthless warranty I took the CD player apart and figured out why it is so cheap in cost and construction. Most of the internal parts look like they fell off of the back of a truck. They are scuffed and poorly made. Rather than weld the wires they used hot glue. (To make it easier to fix when, not if, it breaks?) I would say it was some sort of industrial "special glue," but if it looks, smells, and behaves like hot glue it probably is. It even has the little strings of glue between application sights. (See pictures.) At least three locations use thin cardboard to hold the parts in place. The motherboard does have some welding, but it is some of the worst I have ever seen and isn't uniform. I am no longer amazed that it broke within 10 month of manufacture. I am shocked that it survived this long. Even sitting on my desk must have been a strain for it. I suggest you don't waste your time, desk space, or your money on this items. If you bought it and it still works, it is just a matter of time.
reviews.review_header: 3 month warrenty and hot glue welding!!! Piece of junk, literally.

reviews.review_text: Gorgeous radio! Sturdy, and the audio quality is great. Nice sized speakers that actually produce bass.
reviews.review_header: Sturdy, and the audio quality is great

reviews.review_text: I wanted a light-weight portable player to listen to audio book CDs. This one is exactly what I wanted & I'm very happy with my choice.
reviews.review_header: nice cd player with am fm radio

reviews.review_text: I had bought a portable sterio from Radio Shack for my hard of hearing 93 year old Mother. There was very low volume to the Memorex Boom Box. This was is more compact and good range of volume, we like it. I took the other one back to the store. Thanks, Marcia
reviews.review_header: Has good sound quality

name: Ring Snuggies Ring Sizer or Assorted Sizes Adjuster Set of Six Per Pack

reviews.review_text: Cheap fix to an annoying issue. Bought one pack and was able to adjust the size of my husband's and my own wedding band!
reviews.review_header: Would recommend

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my engagement ring that's become too loose on me. It's at least a whole ring size too big but I could only use the smallest adjuster in this kit. Even then, sometimes it's a bit too snug (since your fingers fluctuate each day). TIP: TRY CUTTING IT IN HALF. You'll gain a little space Since my band is slightly on the thick side, the tube doesn't close all the way. The open rubber tube can get uncomfortable since it'll scratch up your other hand when washing hands or possibly scratching your face when you touch your face. If your ring is at least a whole size too big and you don't want to re-size it (either from fluctuating so much or the anticipation of gaining all that weight back), then this is a doable temporary solution.
reviews.review_header: EH

reviews.review_text: My boyfriend got me a promise ring and it's about a half a size too big. I didn't want to get it resized just yet with summer coming up incase it would be too small. The snuggies work, but only for a little while. In the pictures below I am wearing my ring with the smallest ring snuggie and you can see how much it sticks out. It's annoying to wash my hands (I am a nurse aide) because the snuggie scratches my other hand all the time. I do like that now I know I need to get my ring resized for sure. However, I would not want to wear this any longer than a month.
reviews.review_header: Good for temporary fix only!

reviews.review_text: Honestly these tubing are so thick I am probably better off putting tape on my ring to change the size.... I have enclosed some pictures of what the smallest tube in the package looks on my wedding ring. I gave it two stars because the package did came with 6 different sizes and the plastic seemed to be good quality, but to really make good use of these tubing I will have to figure out how to make its smaller, shorter and thinner or else they look very awkward and uncomfortable as the way it is. I don't know, maybe they will work better on thicker ring? or bigger ring band like husband's ring?!?! we will find out.
reviews.review_header: hmmm.. not really sure about these,

reviews.review_text: I have used these before and I love them. They are clear PVC so they don't turn your fingers and aren't very visible. This set of assorted sizers allowed me to"clip" together two rings; making the ring fit better and, as a bonus, keeps them from rolling around on my finger. As one reviewer already stated, if the sizer is too long it's simple enough to cut. I don't mind using these long term, but I can see how someone would probably only want to use it for a temporary fix.
reviews.review_header: Easy, Convenient, and Affordable

reviews.review_text: This did not last as long as I expected it to. Within a week it had fallen off the ring. Not doing anything major with my hands just your typical day-to-day movements. No hard labor no washing dishes nothing of that sort. I'm plastic just kind of slipped off the ring. We tried different sizes in the same thing happened.
reviews.review_header: Okay.

reviews.review_text: These aren't exactly what I expected. I thought I would be able to adjust for small movements in sizes but the smallest one included it for a full size too big and it makes the ring way too small. The snuggie doesn't follow the curve of the ring either so it's really uncomfortable. Will be returning.
reviews.review_header: Eh.

reviews.review_text: The plastic tubes come in a pack of various sizes. it should fit most rings from large to small. The instructions say to put the snuggy/snuggie on after you have the ring on. I found it easier to take off the ring then put on the snuggy. They hold the ring tightly. Here are the problems that I had with it. First, the ends of the tubes are sharp. The need to be filed down so they don't irritate the fingers. Second, if you use bar soap in the bath, the soap will become caked around the snuggy. Either you have to remove your ring to shower or spend a minute cleaning it after each shower. I was irritated with these issues, so I removed it. I only had a problem of my ring flying off when I was exercising, so I put it back on only then. The rest of the time I snuggled it to my key ring. Eventually it fell of that and got lost. The other tubes aren't the same size so I can't use them now.
reviews.review_header: The plastic tubes come in a pack of various sizes ...
